batch_interactions.request:
Create full API specifications for ALL endpoints in the /current-date resource.

Application Context: A React-based single-page application that displays the current date and time fetched from a Flask backend server with no database requirements. The application should have a visually appealing design.

Endpoints to specify:

1. Endpoint: Get Current Date
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/current-date
   Description: Returns the current date
   Used by pages: Homepage

Return a JSON array with specifications for each endpoint in order:
[
  {"request_body": "describe parameters/body for endpoint 1", "response": "describe response structure for endpoint 1"},
  {"request_body": "describe parameters/body for endpoint 2", "response": "describe response structure for endpoint 2"},
  ...
]

JSON array only:

JSON array only:

Create full API specifications for ALL endpoints in the /error resource.

Application Context: A React-based single-page application that displays the current date and time fetched from a Flask backend server with no database requirements. The application should have a visually appealing design.

Endpoints to specify:

1. Endpoint: Get Error Details
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/error/details
   Description: Fetch error details to display on the error page
   Used by pages: Error Page
2. Endpoint: Report Error
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/error/report
   Description: Send error report to the server
   Used by pages: Error Page
3. Endpoint: Retry Request
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/error/retry
   Description: Retry the failed request
   Used by pages: Error Page

Return a JSON array with specifications for each endpoint in order:
[
  {"request_body": "describe parameters/body for endpoint 1", "response": "describe response structure for endpoint 1"},
  {"request_body": "describe parameters/body for endpoint 2", "response": "describe response structure for endpoint 2"},
  ...
]

Application Context: A React-based single-page application that displays the current date and time fetched from a Flask backend server with no database requirements. The application should have a visually appealing design.

Endpoints to specify:

   Method: GET
   Path: /api/loading/progress
   Description: Returns the loading progress as a percentage
   Used by pages: Loading Screen

Return a JSON array with specifications for each endpoint in order:
[
  {"request_body": "describe parameters/body for endpoint 1", "response": "describe response structure for endpoint 1"},
  {"request_body": "describe parameters/body for endpoint 2", "response": "describe response structure for endpoint 2"},
  ...
]

JSON array only:

endpoints.request_body: No request body is required for this endpoint. It accepts no parameters.
endpoints.response: The response will be a JSON object containing the current date in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD' and the current time in the format 'HH:MM:SS'. Example: {"date": "2024-09-16", "time": "14:30:00"}

endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or body required
endpoints.response: JSON object with a single key 'current_time' containing the current date and time in ISO 8601 format, e.g. {"current_time": "2024-09-16T10:00:00"}

endpoints.description: Returns the current date and time
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or request body required
endpoints.response: JSON object with 'current_datetime' key containing the current date and time in ISO 8601 format, e.g., {'current_datetime': '2024-09-16T10:30:00.000000'}

endpoints.description: Checks if the backend server is running and returns a success response
endpoints.request_body: No request body required. The endpoint does not expect any parameters.
endpoints.response: A JSON object with a single key, 'status', and a value of 'ok' or 'healthy' to indicate the server is running. Example: {"status": "ok"}

endpoints.description: Fetch error details to display on the error page
Send error report to the server
Get the link to the homepage
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or body required
endpoints.response: JSON object with a single key 'link' containing the URL of the homepage, e.g. {"link": "/"}

endpoints.description: Retrieve application name, logo, and description
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or body required
endpoints.response: JSON object with properties: {name: string, logo: string, description: string}, example: {name: 'Current Time App', logo: 'https://example.com/logo.png', description: 'A React-based single-page application that displays the current date and time'}

endpoints.description: Retrieve list of key features of the application
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or request body required
endpoints.response: JSON array of key features, each feature represented as an object with 'id', 'name', and 'description' properties, e.g. [{ 'id': 1, 'name': 'Current Date and Time', 'description': 'Displays the current date and time fetched from the server' }]

endpoints.description: Retrieve information about the technologies used in the application
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or body required for this endpoint
endpoints.response: A JSON array containing objects with the following properties: technology (string), description (string), version (string), and url (string) for each technology used in the application. Example: [{"technology": "React", "description": "Frontend framework", "version": "18.2.0", "url": "https://reactjs.org/"}, {"technology": "Flask", "description": "Backend framework", "version": "2.2.2", "url": "https://flask.palletsprojects.com/"}]

endpoints.description: Fetches the initial data required for the application to load
endpoints.request_body: No request body is required for this endpoint. It only requires the GET method to fetch the initial data.
endpoints.response: The response will be a JSON object containing the current date and time in the following format: {"date": "YYYY-MM-DD", "time": "HH:MM:SS"}

endpoints.description: Checks if the required data is available and ready to be fetched
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or body required
endpoints.response: Boolean value indicating whether the data is available, e.g. {"ready": true}

endpoints.description: Returns the loading progress as a percentage
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or body required

response.progress: integer representing the loading progress as a percentage (0-100)
